website_summaries.verdict: Professional quality and feel at a reasonable price point.
pros: We love the adjustability that allows you to tailor the chair to your liking
The LeatherPlus bonded leather feels like a high-quality surface with a good balance of comfort and durability
Support ring makes a solid platform for the feet
cons: Unable to fit under regular desks

customer_reviews.title: Being a welder I can easily see that the weld that are left on the ...
customer_reviews.text: less than two weeks with light use and the weld inside the back of the chair broke. Being a welder I can easily see that the weld that are left on the back support had near zero penetration.
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Corzine

customer_reviews.title: Very Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I have had this chair for about 1 1/2 years and had no problems with it. When I sat in it today the metal bracket that holds the back cushion snapped and I fell backwards to the floor. Very dangerous. I weigh well under the maximum 250 pound weight limit that the manufacturer recommends and no one else has sat in the chair nor was it ever abused.
customer_reviews.author: Prime customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, uncomfortable, impracticable. DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: Box came battered to heck. All items were just loose in box, no padding or Styrofoam. Pieces inside, surprise surprise, were also beat up. Put together, seat was higher than description, and the back was uncomfortably too far forward even at the furthest setting--while the closest tilted inward setting was just... you couldn't even sit in the seat. Foot ring is also much higher than normal drafting chairs. Arm rests are rattly, cheap plastic, and adjust approximately from "slightly higher than normal chairs, uncomfortable" to "ridiculously, comically high, unusable". Literally the worst chair I've ever bought, and it wasn't even in the cheap price range!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan C.

customer_reviews.title: Better for Shorter Individuals
customer_reviews.text: The seat is too short so my legs hang off funny. I have to put it to the fullest height in order to fit my feet onto the ring. The seat is built for a shorter person but the foot ring is proportioned for a taller person. I am 5'9" and I find it somewhat difficult to use. I did not notice much of a smell like others complained about. It seems relatively sturdy. The padding is firm enough that you don't sink through it when sitting for longer periods. It was easy to put together. If you aren't too tall, this chair should work just fine for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly K.

customer_reviews.title: A bit short
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Nice choice of adjustments. Chair not suitable for working desk heights of 36". For those who like to alternate between standing and sitting with desks above 36 inches, they will find that the chair does not raise high enough. Needs an extension tube of about 6" to make it more versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Lonna L

customer_reviews.title: Broken weld on chair seat after 2.5 yrs
customer_reviews.text: I spent 3-6hrs a day at home in my work shop in this chair over the last 2.5 yrs. The welds on the bottom of the seat cushion mount broke/cracked and it's wobbling around horribly now. looking for a replacement, preferably with cloth seat and mesh back. Leather version didn't allow enough 'airflow' (obviously) and while the seat cushion hasn't worn out, it could use some more padding (none of the screws come through the seat though). Definitely liked all the "adjustments" even though the seat back wouldn't stay locked in the highest position and kept sliding down each day.
customer_reviews.author: M. Grimm

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Quality Chairs that didn't fit my situation
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these chairs for my kitchen island. They were too tall & wide. However the one I put together was very easy to assemble. I was thrilled with the quality of the chair & the price. If you are trying to decide about which arms to get. I purchased the loop ones thinking they would not get hooked up on clothing or each other at the island. Although this is true, they are totally useless as arm rests for a person my height or anyone taller and I'm 5'8". Your elbows just aren't down as low as the loop arm rests unless you are several inches shorter in the torso. Like 3+" shorter. (Senior female review)
customer_reviews.author: FEXY

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chair, but seat cushion is a bit small and the arm supports are set a bit too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: ***Updated***** Three Adjustment Levers: - Angle of the seat back support - Up-down of the seat cushion - Tilt Control level on the left. It locks and unlocks the tilting. No way to push out the arm supports. They are set way too narrow (inwards). The seat cushion is a bit small. It lacks thigh support. - Arm supports do go up and down. Other than these 2 flaws,I would have given this a 5 star rating. Great build quality for the dollar spent. The leather feels premium. It doesn't wobble or shake. Very EASY to assemble: I was able to put it together in 7 minutes using an electric screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rand

customer_reviews.title: Did what I needed and then some for five years.  No major complaints.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this stool on April 16, 2014. Used it almost daily for five years. Ultimately, one of the caster holes broke. Chalk that up to a combination of the plastic base, a not too caster friendly carpet, and my bulk. Still using the stool while I wait for a replacement. Just have to be careful not to lean back. ;) Only other issue I've encountered is a tendency for the cylinder release to slip and let the seat lower. The cylinder itself still works fine. Also worth noting, this product is rated at 275lbs. During the time I've used it, I've averaged closer to 300lbs. So it's met and exceeded expectations in that regard.
customer_reviews.author: Varrick

customer_reviews.title: NOt meant for sitting a long time.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a photographer and graphic designer. Redid my studio with counter height workspace, so I needed a higher chair. I can sit sometimes 8-12 hours a day. Not good ergonomics for those who have to sit for many hours. My feel swell. My legs are not at 90 degrees which should be for those who sit long. The back of my legs itch horribly at where my leg hits the edge of the chair. I'm guessing based on how my legs hang. My ass is so soar. I had a great chair before but not where my rear falls asleep and its hard to move off the chair. Great chair for short sitting. Otherwise, I stand a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey G

customer_reviews.title: Great but WILL NOT LOWER TO NORMAL DESK HEIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: okay I figured if I could not get a tall desk I could just LOWER this chair - NO WAY - I had to buy bed risers to put underneath the casters of my table/desk so I would be at the proper height to use this chair. That said, it has lots of adjustments and is built really well. It is comfortable for long sit times. There is one caveat. The ring for resting your feet is WAY TOO SHORT. You would need to be a contortionist to be able to CURL your feet back far enough to rest comfortably on the foot rest! I use a box, under the desk and in front of the chair instead.
customer_reviews.author: GeekInVegas.Robert

customer_reviews.title: 85 Year Old Dad ... LOVES THIS CHAIR ...No More PAIN !
customer_reviews.text: Bought this chair for my dad's 85th birthday. He's still designing stained glass and the stool he was using didn't support his back or his arms. He loves this chair. It even swivels (wheels), so he doesn't have to arch his back to constantly move the chair. My only question here is, I bought this chair here on amazon for the unbelievable low price of 87 dollars ... While tracking this chair the next week, the price on Amazon constantly fluctuated and is currently 150 dollars ....... duh ? Whatever, I got one heck of a deal and my dad is happy and pretty much designing stained glass, pain free
customer_reviews.author: John Petrocelli

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart very dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: If you have big hips the chair arms bite into your legs, best to get one that doesn't have arms. If you have a larger bottom.... update so early February this year my chair started to have some issues and now it's just awful. I have not had this chair two years and the arm broke off, bolts fell out and it's very wiggly like it won't stay in position now. Very disappointed as this was not a cheap chair.
customer_reviews.author: avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair, decent price
customer_reviews.text: Like it so far very comfortable easy to adjust, too easy till you get the hang of it, I sat on it tried adjusting and felt like i was going to fall off. Just takes a minute of playing with controls to get the right touch. Every body that has sat on lurches 1st time adjusting the tilts even after warning. Using to draw on a Wacom Cintiq DTK2200 22HD. Chair and tablet adjustments allow for comfortable working. Waiting on RISE UP - Electric Adjustable Height Standing Desk w/ Bamboo Desktop (White Frame + Bamboo Top) . Get the table adjustment going too should be very ergonomic.
customer_reviews.author: David McGee

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: I use this chair in a home office, 10 hrs a day and after 2 years a hinge pin broke resulting in the seat now wobbles terrribly. The hinge/shaft design is flawed. ;-(
customer_reviews.author: From Maine

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable chair! I wish I had seen this chair ...
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable chair! I wish I had seen this chair years ago. Would definitely buy again and will buy for other office support! Adjustable in so many ways, there is no problem making this chair work in every instance!
customer_reviews.author: Katacash

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I needed a drafting/lab stool ....something a little higher than a standard desk chair, and more comfortable than a basic bar stool. This fits the bill. The box arrived a little beaten up, but didn't notice any damage inside. Goes together easily (took about 10 mins). Been using it daily, no issues. It's a little tricky to get used to the back adjustments, but once you get familiar with it, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: thomsarg

customer_reviews.title: The perfect drafting stool
customer_reviews.text: I searched and searched for the perfect drafting stool. There was always something that deterred me from making a purchase. Once I found this one it seemed to be a match for what we needed. I purchased one initially and as soon as we had a week on the first stool we bought 2 more. This chair has the perfect amount of height adjustment, the foot rests are positioned perfect, the seat itself is very comfortable and will not leave you sore after an 8-10 hour day, and its easy to assemble. If you're looking for the perfect drafting stool, this is it. Side note: We use this on our 36" high assembly tables, we build motorsport wiring harnesses.
customer_reviews.author: Chase McMaster

customer_reviews.title: The chair was easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: The chair was easy to put together, The back is adjustable for me to sit up straight or lean back. I wish it went to standard height as a I have a mechanical table that adjusts to different heights. I rarely use the armrests as it sits low to on the chair. I also use an additional seat cushion so I cannot comment on the comfort for long periods of time on the chair itself.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Good option for drafting height comfort.
customer_reviews.text: Decent construction. Good lumbar support. The leather-like material isn't very breathable compared to real leather or fabric. Nice amount of adjustability in back, seat tilt, armrests, and height. Overall, it's a nice option for someone who needs a drafting/bar height chair with the comfort of a regular desk chair.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Sundal

customer_reviews.title: Worth it For the Price
customer_reviews.text: For $129, i'm satisfied with this chair. Upon taking out of the box, the chair is in three main pieces: The back (assembled), the seat (assembled), and the base. The base assembly is literally as simple as matching shapes. Once the base is assembled, you put the seat over it, and click them in. From there, you need a screw driver to get in the back, and once you screw in the arms, you're all done. The chair is comfortable, it's versatile when it comes to adjustments, and it looks great. My only complaint would be that I would like the arms to be a little more firm, which isn't really a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: htieguba

customer_reviews.title: 2 in the last 24 months.
customer_reviews.text: I've boughten 2 of these over the last 24 months and they both have broken in different places. I've tried to reach out to Boss and have not gotten a reply, so dont expect the warranty to do much of anything.
customer_reviews.author: BHiggs

customer_reviews.title: Great stools!
customer_reviews.text: In my office we have a few tall or standing desks. However, not everyone wants to stand. I purchased 2 of these stools. They came right away and were packaged very well. These stools were partially constructed already which made the instructions unnecessary. The stools were very easy to install without the instructions and took no time at all to complete. They look and feel great! Very pleased with these stools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Generally, a Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: This chair is both sturdy and comfortable. It also provides good lumbar support. Suggestions for improvement are as follows: a) It would be good to have some padding on the arm rests; and b) When the chair is at its lowest height setting, my feet still dangle off the ground (I'm about 5' 9"). It would be good if the chair could be lowered a bit more. One last comment in this regard: Make sure the desk you use with this chair has sufficient height, or your knees will not fit comfortably under the desk. (The height of the chair at its lowest setting is about 25" from floor to seat cushion.)
customer_reviews.author: StraightArrow

customer_reviews.title: Seat cushion is tilted and back rest pops loudly
customer_reviews.text: The seat cushion has more padding on one side than the other so I'm never sitting on an even surface. Aside from the annoyance, the lopsided cushion is bad for the back and posture. After a couple days of light use the chairs pops loudly every time I lean back against it. I'd recommend spending a little more money for higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Derdan

customer_reviews.title: Great desk chair for drafting table/kitchen island desk.
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was quick and assembly was easy. Needed the versatility in height as we use an IKEA kitchen island table as a desk (36" surface height). With the chair all the way up the armrests meet the table edge and can be rolled under if lowered about an inch. The cushioning is comfortable though pretty sturdy and the leatherish material feels like it'll last a while. The roller wheels are also very smooth. The plastic armrests do feel a little cheaper and have a bit of flex and give but seem like they should hold up to regular use.
customer_reviews.author: wkyblue82

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a pretty good chair
customer_reviews.text: It's not perfect, it's not amazing or incredible, but its pretty legit, especially for the price. The height is great for a tall desk. My desk height is ~32 inches high and it fits perfectly for it. At its highest point, the arms are just barely too tall to fit under the desk completely, which is desirable for me. Offers the option to not use the footring/extra ~8-12 inches of height if you don't want to. I didn't want to spend 200 bucks for a designer or big name chair and I was nervous I would get very low quality. I'm not mad about my decision to go with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Tsamis

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was horrible. Just thrown into a box
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was horrible. Just thrown into a box. Parts fell out the bottom and box delivered upside down and open. Next time parts were sticking out of the box. Same thing parts just thrown into the box. Sent back a second time. Next time a part was sticking out of the box but opened the box anyway same thing parts just thrown into the box. Did put it together. Chair is OK but the foot rest is to small. Can hardly get my foot to stay on the bar. Should be much larger. It is pretty comfortable. Decided to keep the chair.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bartos

customer_reviews.title: Product was very easy to put together however
customer_reviews.text: Product was very easy to put together however, leather had two slashes in it on the top and bottom corners. Very disappointed that I had it out of the box and put together to find these... not easy to returnnthis way!
customer_reviews.author: Belle of Hope

customer_reviews.title: Best chair ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have been having back issues and my physical therapist told me I needed a chair with good back support. I use this at the podium in my classroom and it is soooo comfortable. My husband had it assembled in minutes, it was very easy to adjust, I was able to tilt the back, the seat, adjust the arms, and adjust the height of the seat. It is the best chair I have ever had for work and I have had more than a few. The best part - no more backaches!
customer_reviews.author: Linda  D.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: The seat itself is not very deep so if you are anything other than petite it will feel too short. The back does recline to multiple positions and the hydraulics offers a nice variety of height options. Padding on the chair is average - considering the cost of the chair. Overall, the chair fits the specific need for us since it is used in a very small, confined area but I would not purchase this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Mary M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stools.
customer_reviews.text: The stool are nice but a little high and ring to rest your feet on, need to be lowered about 3 inches.
customer_reviews.author: tame

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy construction
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy chair. Rotation and chair adjustments are smooth. You get three degrees of freedom: up/down, tilt of seat, and tilt of backing. Self -installation was pretty quick (<30 minutes) and instructions were straightforward. The backing I got was completely covered with leather (like the picture). The fixed loop arms are too high to fit under my table if I scoot too far in. I got this chair for a tall standing desk (34.5"), and use the chair on its highest setting (there's about a 6 in gap between my table and the chair seat).
customer_reviews.author: ttd

customer_reviews.title: good support with adjustment for customization
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my drafting desk. I stand part of the day and then sit in the afternoon. I like the adjustment arms because I can set each one individually to support my dominant arm and my non dominant arm for all day comfort. There is 3 adjustments (height, tilt, and back support). It was an absolute dream first day using it. This chair might put my chiropractor out of business.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Bratzel

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy, and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: One of the most uncomfortable chairs ever. The foot rail was way too high to be useful unless you are double jointed. Then this week two of the castors just snapped off causing a fall. This chair only lasted about 16 . I normally get three to four years from a chair and usually the gas strut fails. I've never had a leg break off. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound construction
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this chair through my church. I run the sound for my church so I have to sit high above the sound board.The chair is solid and comfortable. It has plenty of range for up and down adjustments. It moves very well on the carpet and the foot rest is great.I would buy this item for home use also.
customer_reviews.author: Banrman

customer_reviews.title: Bag packaging, Broken, bad quality, and expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived damaged, is made of cheap material, and not worth the price. The box was obviously reused. Had been taped up at least three times. Instructions were not for the chair that was in the box and notice on the top of the box says parts and numbers will not match. WTF!
customer_reviews.author: Miken_ike

customer_reviews.title: The foot ring postion complaints are legitimate
customer_reviews.text: I'm 69 inches tall with a 32 inch inseam. The foot rest is barely usable with the chair fully lifted. If you are short this chair might be what you are looking for. Tall people avoid unless you can reach the floor comfortably without the foot rest, which is about 28.5 inches from the seat to the floor at full lift. Outside the foot rest issue, this chair is reasonably comfortable, best part is the back support.
customer_reviews.author: TnT

customer_reviews.title: Danger!
customer_reviews.text: chair was delivered today 11-15-2017.The box was in very bad shape.My thought was to take pictures.but ups is known for trashing box so what the heck. Got the chair together ,put it on the floor .snaped one of the arms for the leg off leaving fourand a half legs.Anyway chair is useless.stay away from these chairs
customer_reviews.author: chuck malone

customer_reviews.title: I really love this chair
customer_reviews.text: I really love this chair. I am actually probably going to buy another for my new office, where I also have a standing desk. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is so not to mislead potential buyers. I put it together and it has some wobbly points. However, that could be from user malfunction. This may not be the most customizable, perfect chair, but it is certainly a fantastic value and quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: Material is cheap. Hard to adjust back.
customer_reviews.text: The quality is terrible. It's easy to put together, but the chair came damaged and the back is hard to adjust. Just doesn't work. I will keep it for now because I have no choice, but will purchase another chair as soon as I can. I would not buy this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Wheels Baby!
customer_reviews.text: Use this on a drafting table. Nice rotation and support.
customer_reviews.author: PJK

customer_reviews.title: Chair came sooner than expected and was pretty easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Chair came sooner than expected and was pretty easy to put together. Not much for technical handiness needed. Just a screwdriver and about 20 minutes. Chair works great and my staff love it. Update: during the first 6 months that we had this chair i had to reach out to get a new piece to prevent the chair from wobbling from side to side. Then again after replacing that piece it went bad again. Would not recommend this chair as it is basically junk now, and feels very unsafe to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse S. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great chair!
customer_reviews.text: My 8th grade son is in cyber school, so we got this chair for him to do his schoolwork in. He loves it and finds it really comfortable. We plan on getting him another one for his desk in his room. He's been using daily it for over 6 months and it's still just as comfortable as when he got it.
customer_reviews.author: Just Ducky

customer_reviews.title: Great for work at home
customer_reviews.text: I’ve loved this chair for work for the past 4 years and it’s served me well! The back of the chair lever has collapsed so unfortunately it’s time to say adieu. I have moved it as well and it traveled well. I removed the hand rests too and like it both ways. It fits better with my desk without the rest. Highly recommend. Would give it 5 stars if it still lasted
customer_reviews.author: Emily Matthews

customer_reviews.title: read this before buying
customer_reviews.text: This chair isn't as comfortable as an executive chair or anything, but I tend to sit in it for long periods of time and it doesn't hurt my back. Very adjustable so you can easily make the chair comfortable. Someone else mentioned that this chair doesn't go up to a 36" desk and at its lowest setting it is perfectly fine for my 33" desk so I definitely think it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is our second one
customer_reviews.text: Second of these we have bought. They are shorter than we would like as we have a tall counter in our service department at our rv dealership. We had the guys in the shop make some risers and all is great with them now. They get used 6 days a week between 5-6 hrs. No problem with the chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy J Bullington

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for a taller workstation
customer_reviews.text: The chair is very comfortable and sturdy. I've been using it everyday for about 9 months in my studio and besides some wear and tear on the back which was my own fault it still looks new.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Did somebody say backgasm?
customer_reviews.text: Backgasm. It's like the opposite of back spasm. As in, "I was having back spasms from using an old wooden barstool as a desk chair until I got this BOSS drafting chair, and now I am having a backgasm." I am not terribly competent at putting furniture together. I've been known to puts desks together backwards with the keyboard tray upside-down. I once cried while attempting to assemble a Walmart tent. But I was able to put this baby together by myself in about 5 minutes, with just a quick glance at the instructions, and had I not wanted armrests, I could have done it with no tools.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Looks very nice and professional
customer_reviews.text: Looks very nice and professional. I love all the adjustments. It's very nice to be able to customize it the way I like to sit and then quickly and easily adjust it for when my kids need to use it. It's comfortable enough to sit in for a good long time and the wheels roll very smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Petros

customer_reviews.title: Just don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This chair is sooooo uncomfortable! I weigh 180 lbs and my butt is sore after just 30 mins in the saddle.The armrests are uncomfortably close and too high at their lowest level. And now to top it off, I am trying to take it apart to return it but that is pretty much impossible! So there goes $140 down the drain. Seriously, there are better options out there and this isn't one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cota

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay
customer_reviews.text: This chair is just okay. It's comfortable and the adjustments work well but the vinyl on the seat is thin and tore after only one week. It tore where the piping on the back of the seat bumped against the sheetrock wall. Be sure if you buy it not to put too much pressure on the armrest when you push yourself up out of the seat. I've noticed the arm rest are weakening and wobble a little.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for crafting
customer_reviews.text: I am a scrapbooker and got this to use with my countertop-height crafting table. I LOVE this chair! It has lots of adjustability options so I can configure it to my personal comfort. It seems to be constructed of very heavy-duty materials. The 5-point base is weighty and stable. It was SUPER easy to put together. Roomy seat and very comfortable. The only negative comment I could make is that the packaging could have been a little better. The parts bang around in the large box (which is not heavy duty) during shipment. One of my parts was damaged on arrival due to this. Customer service was awesome though and a replacement was sent out right away.
customer_reviews.author: vidalia68

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for the money, hole in box but that didn't hurt anything. I use it every day with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: donandmax

customer_reviews.title: other than that it is nice
customer_reviews.text: if you are short you will need to buy a lumbar support pillow as the lumbar support is more for taller people... the one bummer about this chair is I was hoping git would be low in enough but tall enough for my needs and I still needed to pull off the wheels to get it the height I needed.. other than that it is nice chair
customer_reviews.author: NLS

customer_reviews.title: Solid Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought 5 of these 6 months ago and they are getting used several hour every day. Really great quality, No issues with the materials handling the daily use, very pleased with the adjustability
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great drafting chair
customer_reviews.text: We have a drafting desk and were having trouble finding a chair that was tall enough. Landed on this one and couldn't be happier. Very easy to put together and seems very sturdy. You have the option of installing the armrests or leaving them off. Good adjustment options and is comfortable. Can't beat it for the price either!
customer_reviews.author: Jetspeed

customer_reviews.title: Heed warning of others.. it will come busted to pieces....
customer_reviews.text: Heed the advice of other reviewers. This item is indeed extremely poorly packaged. Mine arrived busted into pieces. The paddles that allow for tilt and hight adjustment were busted off. The interface between the seat and backrest was busted. One of the six legs was sticking through the box when it arrived. This is not an Amazon or UPS issue. The manufacturer basically just threw it in a box. Sadly, I don't have time to send it back. That being said, the chair would not be bad if it arrived intact. Its exactly what you would expect for ~$120. Its rather comfortable and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B. Deese

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this chair since November 2015. To this point, one of the arms has snapped off and the chair definitely does not hold it's height. I am not rough on the chair at all and I am not over the weight so that should not be a problem. Not to mention that this chair is not very comfortable so I have to use a seat cushion. This is definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Wynn

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only six months!
customer_reviews.text: The chair initially fulfilled all my expectations, and I was quite pleased with it. However, within six months, the seat mounting bracket broke, leaving the seat to wobble laterally on the post. I weigh 215 pounds and was careful in my treatment of the chair. I feel it should have lasted longer than six months. I'm replacing it with a more expensive and (presumably) more durable model.
customer_reviews.author: radioguy

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my 36" table
customer_reviews.text: I have a taller craft table that I wanted to sit at and this works well. I can get exact measurements if people are interested but I still sit on a pillow to get an extra couple inches in height before I"m comfortable at my higher desk. I'm 6'3 and I needed a larger stool to feel comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: ANDY G

customer_reviews.title: Footrest not adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these and found that the foot rest is not adjustable in height like most lab stools. The height was found to be unacceptable by not one but all of my production employees. I had to return the items. The web description should explicitly say that the foot rest in not adjustable and give the height.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry D. Crane

customer_reviews.title: This is a comfortable chair but
customer_reviews.text: This is a comfortable chair but......if you put any pressure on the arms they bend. The seat lock doesn't work anymore and now the chair isn't tall enough for my work. I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice stool for a tall project desk
customer_reviews.text: This stool is good if you have a really tall office desk, more like a project desk. This is a good price for a drafting stool. It is easy to assemble. The seat cover is made from a really nice material, something like a smooth leather. The packaging was a bit broken when it came, maybe because the item is kinda heavy. The delivery was on time.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Good but huge!
customer_reviews.text: Good chair but HUGE! For larger people with more floor space. Easy to set up. Nice multiple adjustments! Easy cleaning "pleather" material.
customer_reviews.author: CURIO

customer_reviews.title: Not rated for overweight people. The middle pole broke ...
customer_reviews.text: Not rated for overweight people. The middle pole broke through the bottom leg piece and now its stuck at a "normal" height chair. So I can no longer use it for my standing desk. (Even then, it wasn't quite as high as I needed it for my standing desk.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: It's an OK chair so far. It does not sit straight up and down though. The connector to make this a "tall" chair does not keep the post straight up and down. I have to turn the base till it's learning forward or backward because tilting left and right feels weird.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: It's a perfect fit for what we needed
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and use this for 8+ hours a day working at my desk. We built a kitchen counter height desk and realized after the fact that most if not all typical office chairs do not extend this high. It's a perfect fit for what we needed. Comfortable, even after multiple hours!
customer_reviews.author: Jami M

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy..
customer_reviews.text: This chair was meant to me a new item. When I received it the packing was no existent and you could clearly see by the foot prints on the legs and the marks on the seat that it was a used item. So I have sent it back and will go somewhere else for a chair. Please be aware before you buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Terrible footrest design
customer_reviews.text: The footrest on this chair is fixed at 11.5 inches from the floor. There is no way to adjust it. When the chair is at its highest position, 29", the foot rest is a little too high. When the chair is in it's lowest position, 25", the footrest is ridiculously too high. I can't get my knees under my 34" bench when my feet are on the footrest. Note that this is actually a normal desk chair. They ship it with a second box containing a footrest and an extender pipe that converts the normal chair into a poor drafting stool.
customer_reviews.author: P. Stadler

customer_reviews.title: Nice chairs! I have two of these in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice chairs! I have two of these in my recording studio and they have held up great. Fairly comfortable and a lot of adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice chair - very versatile. It went together easily - it's not hard, but if you need good assembly instructions, this doesn't have them - just pictures. The box was pretty beat-up and ripping when i got it, but everything was in there undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: Kryptonite451

customer_reviews.title: Leans to left and wobbles
customer_reviews.text: It wobbles or leans to the left side, also the seat is too thin. I am 6ft 210 lbs, the seat is uncomfortable. I will give this to a family member to use in his workshop. I ordered a $300.00 drafting chair (from Amazon, keep looking) that has a 5 inch seat. It is beautiful, you need to spend the extra money if you sit a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Arms break off
customer_reviews.text: The first chair delivered had a broken arm (injection molded plastic) in the delivery package. The second chair delivered was OK, but the one of the arms broke off after about two weeks of use. Otherwise, the chair mechanisms them selves are still working. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: D. G. Mehaffey

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at a couple of drafting stools that were twice the price of this one. Ended up going with this one and I am happy I did. Very comfortable chair and a great range of adjustment. The only thing I wish it had was an adjustable footrest.
customer_reviews.author: BS Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: The chair is perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: The chair is perfect for me. I had to upgrade the casters from the 50LB units to 75LB units because in leaning forward on the chair that caster broke. Otherwise, this is a great product. The casters were available from Boss as a warrenty item.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Whitehouse

customer_reviews.title: not awesome quality but its the best price for a chair ...
customer_reviews.text: not awesome quality but its the best price for a chair likethis i have seen pros assembles easily reasonably comfortable cons cheaply made (expected), but pretty solid (pleasantly surprised) needs a wheel break to keep in position sometimes you move and the chair rolls away...
customer_reviews.author: Professor Woland

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair a few months ago and was so excited about it. I got it put it together before the end of the first day the circular piece fell off. I am not even sure how it was attached in the first place because it was so flimsy. I decided to try gluing it back together instead of dealing with the hassle of mailing it back. This worked fine. Today not even 6 months later, the arm on the chair just broke completely off. This purchase was very disappointing​.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: This chair started off okay, and as the months went on it started to fall apart. It now wobbles all over the place and the adjustable locks don’t work so the chair is pretty much useless now. If you need it to last, spend the extra money and go for more quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit and finish and quality for money
customer_reviews.text: Great chair for the price! Seems to be made of good quality materials and the fit and finish are very nice. I've purchased other Boss furniture for my customer lounges and have had good success with the quality so I am going back to the brand again. I purchased 3 of these to replace some Drafting stools for my employees that the armrests and seat covers came apart on in less than 2 years. Assembly was a little trickier than expected, but not difficult, and each chair took about 30 minutes to assemble. Will update review after using for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: CM F

customer_reviews.title: Super chair just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Super chair just what I was looking for. For my shop but word of caution if you buy it get the solid no.wheel casters as on a smooth floor with the wheel casters your going for a fast ride across the room when you get up.from it other than that EXCELLENT quality a nd chair!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J L

customer_reviews.title: Like the chair.
customer_reviews.text: Like the chair, but it would've been nice to have instructions on putting it together in addition to the picture of the bottom half.
customer_reviews.author: E Cody

customer_reviews.title: This chair made it about 3 months before I broke ...
customer_reviews.text: This chair made it about 3 months before I broke it. I guess you get what you pay for. Basically, the way the back is connected to the seat is too low and moderate pressure on the back caused it to break off. Now there's no support.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: ... back rest locking device broke and they won'n make good on it I have had this chair for 7 ...
customer_reviews.text: The back rest locking device broke and they won'n make good on it I have had this chair for 7 months it broke and they say its too late to get it replaced. I will never buy anything from them again!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: ronald esterline

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Reloading Bench and Hornady Lock-n-Load Progressive Press
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Reloading Bench and Hornady Lock-n-Load Progressive Press. Its easier to sit than stand to reload. Assembly is so simple I read the instructions and thought something had to be missing and called their Customer Service to see if their was expanded instructions. Just follow the instructions and its a 10 minute job.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck K.

customer_reviews.title: Big Comfortable Stool
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy chair with multi adjustments for seat height, tilt and back up and down to place the lumbar support right where it's needed. Quality materials in seat padding and covering. Only problem for me is the 'foot-rest ring' is not able to be lowered enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Hill

customer_reviews.title: Nice Chair!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, durable, adjustable, and not too hard on the eye. Assembly was simple. Can't go wrong with this really...
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D. Covey

customer_reviews.title: Fragile and poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: Arm broke off after two months of use, just snapped at the base.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice chair, especially for the great price. Nicely padded seat and back for extra comfort, and I love the adjustable feature. I've assembled it with the wheels, but also ordered the glider feet so I'll have them in case I need to use the chair on a slippery surface.
customer_reviews.author: DogLover

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I purchased on 10/19/14 and the back support broke on 7/19/16. Junk!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Stiff. Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I needed a tall drafting chair and alot of reviewers here said this is a good chair, comfortable and soft. I could not sit on here for long. Not comfortable at all. The leather like material is really stiff. It was easy to put together, so it was easy to take apart to return.
customer_reviews.author: WD17

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this chair
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this chair. I have kind of high desk with a bad back...so I looked long and hard for just the right stool! I have had no issues from using this stool with my back! It was also easy breezy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia H

customer_reviews.title: VERY COMFY, BUT ?...................
customer_reviews.text: As comfortable as it can be for what it is. But just like the cheap office chairs, the riser piston goes bad quickly. Mine lost capacity to hold the full up position in about 3 months of light duty use. And no, I’m only 165 pounds!
customer_reviews.author: Felix The CAT

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service from manufacture
customer_reviews.text: Arm rest broke off while adjusting myself in seat. Horrible customer service from manufacture. Will not even let me buy a replacement. Had the chair one month. Too bad. It's a nice chair.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Thornburg

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Seat
customer_reviews.text: Received this item with a damaged seat back. Found damage after removing the plastic once assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice Vance

customer_reviews.title: Not so Great Chair
customer_reviews.text: Really an awkward looking chair and super uncomfortable. Had to pay return shipping and a 15% re-stocking fee because it wasn't fulfilled by Amazon, so pay attention to the details when purchasing a chair.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle - Alki Beach

customer_reviews.title: Drafting Chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chair for the money. I am 235 lbs and it works just fine and is very comfortable because it has all the adjustments that one could want for various body sizes. I recommend it for sure and I don't think that there is a better one for the money.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who is going to college and spends hours and hours at his drafting table. Most other chairs have support only on the mid to upper back, where as this chair has full support. I am happy to announce he not longer has back aches. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this chair. I have back problems and use for a counterat work and no counter height bar stool was comfortable. I had shopped in person extensively and basically gave up and ordered this one to give it a try. This one is awesome and for the price could not be beat. Only took a few minutes t assemble. I love all of the adjustment options. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The chair wasn't the right adjustable height and we even ...
customer_reviews.text: The chair wasn't the right adjustable height and we even called Boss directly to see if a piece could be left off and still use the chair. Boss Rep said yes but that was not the case. We also had to wait a week to return it as we had to have the boss come in to take the chair a part to even return it as once you put it together and sit in it to test it, the seat wedges together and it nearly impossible to take a part again.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Walton

product_meta.title: Boss Office Products Multi-Function LeatherPlus Drafting Stool with Loop Arms in Black
product_meta.description: Size:LeatherPlus,With Loop ArmsUpholstered in Black LeatherPlus. Back angle lock allows the back to lock throughout the angle range for perfect back support. Seat tilt lock allows the seat to lock throughout the tilt range. Pneumatic gas lift seat height adjustment. Nylon base. Hooded double wheel casters. Loop arms. 20" diameter chrome Footring. Weight Capacity- 275 pounds.
feature_bullets: Back angle lock allows the back to lock throughout the angle range for perfect back support
Seat tilt lock allows the seat to lock throughout the tilt range
Pneumatic gas lift seat height adjustment
Upholstered In Black Leatherplus and a 20" Diameter Chrome Footring
Back Angle Lock Allows The Back To Lock Throughout The Angel Range For Perfect Back Support
Seat Tilt Lock Allows The Seat To Lock Throughout The Tilt Range with Loop Arms
Pneumatic Gas Lift Seat Height Adjustment
5 Star Nylon Base Allows Smooth Movement and Stability with Hooded Double Wheel Casters

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars582 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
